title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.25 - 30 Part 3 | 03-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chaksharan Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gaurabhani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gnadhara Shri Vasani Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Devim Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this sense,
we continue to discuss from the verses 25 to 30
from the 16th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
These are a series of verses
in which 40 different qualities
of the Supreme Lord,
the transcendental qualities of the Supreme Lord,
are mentioned, listed by the earthly deity Mother Earth
in the form of a cow while replying to the questions of dharma,
the personality of religious principles in the form of a bull.
So the discussion is very important because to understand, actually,
what is dharma
and to also understand
the different transcendental qualities which are
there in the Supreme Lord
is very important
for anyone interested in
Krishna Consciousness.
So Srila Prabhupada
writes a very elaborate purport
for the
these verses
in the Srimad Bhagavatam.
And we have already finished
discussing in the past two sessions,
part one and part two,
some of the
qualities described here,
particularly the first point that Prabhupada makes in this purport to this,
these set of verses.
He says that
it is not possible
to count
the number of
transcendental qualities the Lord possesses.
Even if
one were to compare this number
to the number of
atoms,
one can obtain by smashing
the entire universe
into small particles of dust.
Still
you cannot compare that number of atoms
in the
universe
total number of atoms
to
the number of
transcendental qualities possessed by the Lord.
Which means that
the number of transcendental qualities of the Lord are unlimited.
Whereas the
number of atoms in this universe is a finite number
is not unlimited.
It is not unlimited.
So therefore,
some qualities are being mentioned here.
Just for our understanding,
still the number is not a small number still.
Forty qualities are mentioned here
by Mother Earth
while replying to
Dharini,
Dharini Vacha.
That is the beginning of these words,
Dharini Vacha.
She is replying to the questions asked by Dharma.
The previous set of verses before this.
Dharma Vacha,
that is the principle of,
sorry, the personality of religious principles,
Dharma,
in the shape of a bull,
is inquiring from
Dharini, Mother Earth,
in the shape of a cow.
And Dharini is replying
that
in the Supreme Lord,
there reside all good qualities
which are to be found among different people in this world.
So, since we are a very, very insignificant part of the Lord,
we have some qualities of the Lord
in a very, very minute quantity.
So, we should remember,
Lord is completely spiritual,
we are also completely spiritual beings.
But the Lord is
unlimited personality and we are always limited.
Unlimited transcendental qualities we have
and he has those qualities to an
unlimited extent.
Just like the prayer we offer to Krishna,
we say,
Hey Krishna, Karuna, Sindho,
you are an ocean of compassion.
Now, comparison to the ocean means
that he has got unlimited compassion.
And what is the proof?
That even though there are so many millions and billions
and trillions of living entities who are
almost completely forgetful of the Lord in this world,
still the Lord out of compassion for each one of them,
because they are insignificant.
They are many and they are insignificant, but still,
as far as Krishna is concerned,
every living being, he says, is my part and parcel.
Cannot be separated from me, Krishna says.
So, he cares for every one of us
and his compassion is so much
that he personally comes to this world
in the form of
three Vishnus
and incarnates as three Vishnus.
The Mahavishnu, the Padmanabha Vishnu
and the maintainer Vishnu.
Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, you would have heard these three names.
So, that maintainer Vishnu.
That maintainer Vishnu expands as Paramatma
and enters the heart of every living being.
Why? Why does he do so?
In order to actually direct
and satisfy the desires
and give the intelligence
and make the living entity,
the Jeeva, in a particular body
for the Jeeva to live in that body
and to utilize this bodily
and to utilize this bodily
and to utilize this bodily
functions,
the Lord is facilitating as Paramatma.
So, that is his kindness.
He fulfills the desires of the living being.
Even though those desires are
not really
very conducive for the actual happiness
of the living being,
still, because we are very, very adamant,
we are stubborn,
we want to fulfilment of our material desires.
Even though we are not meant to live in the material world,
we are not meant to have material body,
we are not meant for material enjoyment,
we are not meant for that.
Because we are spirit soul.
So, we are meant for spiritual pleasure,
we are meant for spiritual existence,
we are meant for spiritual body.
We are meant for spiritual happiness.
And that is wonderful.
That is very, very nice.
That is everlasting.
But anyway,
as long as we desire and we are stubborn,
we desire material enjoyment
and we are stubborn about it,
we don't want to give up.
Even though,
in all the scriptures it is said,
if you give up these material desires,
then immediately
you become free from so much of suffering.
All the material desires are the cause of our suffering.
And the cause of our suffering
and the cause of our material existence
are the cause of so many problems and complications
in our life.
But still,
if we are very stubborn,
and we are about to give up all our catacombs,
and we are about to give up our service,
we must,
we have to give up everything.
That is,
if I don't give up,
they will come after me.
If we don't give up the service,
the service will not come after us.
If we don't give up everything,
the service will not come after us.
That is the only way.
So,
we have to fear our universe.
sitting next to the particular soul who has got that body so he is actually fulfilling the desires
so that is proof of his compassion so some of the qualities of the lord are being analyzed
by srila prabhupada in the purport based on the the commentaries
by the previous acharyas so we already discussed about the third quality mentioned among the 40
qualities intolerance of another's happiness intolerance of another's happiness
um so this quality
it was explained in a previous session i'll proceed next to the
the tenth quality of equality
the tenth quality of equality the lord is equally kind to everyone
what does it mean the lord has got this quality of equality he is equally kind to everyone
equally kind to everyone
as the sun is equal in distributing its rays over everyone the sun is shining in the sky
is there any discrimination on the part of the sun regarding who actually will get that
sunshine
no discrimination but there are people who are unable to take advantage of the sunshine
similarly prabhupad says the lord says that surrendering unto him is the
guarantee for all protection from him he will give protection
You just surrender to him and he will guarantee all protection.
But unfortunate persons are unable to accept this proposition.
There are some people who won't surrender to the Lord.
In the Bhagavad Gita in the seventh chapter it is described, there are four kinds of people
who surrender to Krishna and there are four other kinds of people who don't surrender
to Krishna.
So the ones who don't surrender to Krishna, they don't get his personal protection.
And therefore, because they don't have his personal protection, such people who don't
surrender to Krishna suffer from all material miseries which are there in the material world.
Material world means material existence means miseries.
This is also explained in the Bhagavad Gita.
This material world is described as Dukkhaalayam Ashashvatam, it's a temporary place filled
with miseries, Dukkhaalayam.
Dukkha means miseries, alayam means filled with, full of miseries and so many miseries.
So even though the Lord is equally well-wishing to everyone, he does not say some people I
will not give you.
Protection.
He doesn't say if you are a non-devotee, I will not give you protection, no he doesn't
say that.
Neither he acts in that way.
But the unfortunate living being due to bad association only, it is bad association.
Such a person due to bad association is unable to accept the Lord's instructions in toto.
Means they don't completely accept and for this the Lord is never to be blamed.
We have foolishly come to this material world desiring material enjoyment.
There is no material enjoyment in the spiritual world and we as spiritual beings, we belong
to the spiritual world.
But then we desire material enjoyment.
Then we insist on that.
Then we insist on that.
Then we insist on that.
Then we insist on that.
We are stubborn about it.
Then the Lord makes arrangement for us to come to this material world because that's
material enjoyment is possible only in the material world.
Now the material world, the characteristic is such that it is filled with miseries.
There is no pure happiness in this material world.
Pure happiness is only in the spiritual world.
Spiritual world there is no distress.
There is no unhappiness.
There is no misery.
There is no old age.
There is no disease.
There is no death.
So that is spiritual world.
So having come here, now that we may realize in the human form that I am suffering even
though I don't want to suffer miseries.
And we are also trying to avoid suffering.
We are also trying to avoid suffering.
We are also trying to avoid suffering.
You have not been able to suffer this suffering in so many ways, our own ways but when one
comes in touch with Shastra scriptures one understands that if we surrender to God then
God will free us from this suffering but people don't surrender then they have to blame.
They have to suffer.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
